---
title: "import_two_namespaces_default_and_foo.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file defines feature flags and segments for two different namespaces. It contains configuration for four feature flags (flag1, flag2, flag3, flag4) and two segments (segment1, segment2) across two namespaces (foo and default).

## Code Structure
The file is structured into two YAML documents separated by `---`. The first document defines the "foo" namespace, while the second document implicitly defines the default namespace.

## Symbols

### Namespace: foo
#### Description
This namespace contains two feature flags (flag1 and flag2) and one segment (segment1).

#### Internal Logic
- Defines two feature flags with different types and configurations
- Defines one segment with specific matching criteria

### Flag: flag1
#### Description
A variant-type feature flag with one variant and associated rules.

#### Internal Logic
- Enabled by default
- Has one variant (variant1) with a complex attachment
- Includes a rule for segment1 with 100% rollout for variant1

### Flag: flag2
#### Description
A boolean-type feature flag with rollout configurations.

#### Internal Logic
- Disabled by default
- Has two rollout configurations:
  1. Enabled for internal users
  2. Enabled for 50% of users

### Segment: segment1
#### Description
A segment with a single constraint for matching users.

#### Internal Logic
- Uses ANY_MATCH_TYPE for matching
- Has a constraint comparing the "fizz" property to "buzz"

### Namespace: default (implicit)
#### Description
This namespace contains two feature flags (flag3 and flag4) and one segment (segment2).

#### Internal Logic
- Defines two feature flags with different types and configurations
- Defines one segment with specific matching criteria

### Flag: flag3
#### Description
A variant-type feature flag with minimal configuration.

#### Internal Logic
- Enabled by default
- No variants or rules specified

### Flag: flag4
#### Description
A boolean-type feature flag with rollout configurations.

#### Internal Logic
- Disabled by default
- Has two rollout configurations:
  1. Enabled for users in segment2
  2. Enabled for 50% of users

### Segment: segment2
#### Description
A segment with a single constraint for matching users.

#### Internal Logic
- Uses ANY_MATCH_TYPE for matching
- Has a constraint comparing the "length" property to "short"

## Configuration
The file defines the following configuration options:

| Option | Type | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:------------|
| namespace | string | Defines the namespace for flags and segments |
| flags | array | List of feature flags |
| segments | array | List of segments for user targeting |

Each flag has the following common options:

| Option | Type | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the flag |
| name | string | Display name for the flag |
| type | string | Type of the flag (e.g., VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE, BOOLEAN_FLAG_TYPE) |
| description | string | Description of the flag's purpose |
| enabled | boolean | Whether the flag is enabled by default |

Variant flags may have additional options like `variants` and `rules`, while boolean flags may have `rollouts`.

Segments have the following options:

| Option | Type | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the segment |
| name | string | Display name for the segment |
| match_type | string | Type of matching to use (e.g., ANY_MATCH_TYPE) |
| description | string | Description of the segment's purpose |
| constraints | array | List of constraints for matching users to the segment |

This configuration file is likely used to define feature flags and user segments for a feature flagging system, allowing for controlled rollout of features to different user groups across multiple namespaces.
